23-0117.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes for the State Legislation Committee meeting held Tuesday, May 3, 2022.A motion was made by Chair Uranga, seconded by Vice Chair Austin, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 2 - Uranga and AustinPage 1 of 3411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 3:45 PMTUESDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHSTATE LEGISLATION COMMITTEE MINUTES2.

23-0118.summary: Recommendation to receive and file staff recommendations for the City’s 2023 State Legislative Agenda, gather input from the State Legislation Committee, and forward the Committee’s recommendations to the City Council for adoption.Tyler Curley, Manager of Government Affairs, spoke; and presented the staff report.Chair Uranga spoke.Tyler Curley, Manager of Government Affairs, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Uranga and Tyler Curley, Manager of Government Affairs.Vice Chair Austin spoke.Tyler Curley, Manager of Government Affairs, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Vice Chair Austin and Tyler Curley, Manager of Government Affairs.Anna Christensen spoke.Chair Uranga spoke.A motion was made by Chair Uranga, seconded by Vice Chair Austin, to approve recommendation, as amended, to receive and file staff recommendations for the City’s 2023 State Legislative Agenda, gather input from the State Legislation Committee, including adding language for regional based advocacy regarding housing issues and people experiencing homelessness, and forward the Committee’s recommendations to the City Council for adoption.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 2 - Uranga and Austin3.
